parameters: \af[2]\n<\N[2]>There's some extra oil here too we can use.
\n<Guard>You\..\..\..\. you're alive. Something is happening, something strange.
\n<Guard>I\..\..\..\. I don't think I'm going to make it. Find \N[4], he'll know what to do.
\af[1]\n<\N[1]>We can help you.\! \N[2]!\| Help me carry him!
\af[2]\n<\N[2]>\N[1],\| he's not going to make it.
\af[1]\n<\N[1]>We aren't going to leave to you here!
\af[2]\n<\N[2]>We can't help him now but his armor.\| His equipment could help us.
\af[1]\n<\N[1]>I suppose we'll put it to good use.
this.newNotif("Prefixes and Suffixes entry added to Compendium")
<c:0,60,25>I don't think I'm going to make it
The floor around this block look almost mechanical.
\af[2]\n<\N[2]>Of course! I can dual wield them.
Some sort of piston is holding this block up.
The floor around this block look almost mechanical.
\af[1]\n<\N[1]>Maybe Gus escaped, maybe he climbed out.
\af[2]\n<\N[2]>I've seen things like this before. There's some complex mechanism keeping it locked.
Unlock secrets by interacting with your environment
\af[1]\n<\N[1]>We seem to have shifted this boulder onto some sort of switch.
\af[2]\n<\N[2]>Sounds like something shifted in the next room.
\af[1]\n<\N[1]>I'm not sure, but that definitely felt like an earthquake.
\af[2]\n<\N[2]>An earthquake,\| in \e['Rivington.Param.kingdomName']? We've never had an earthquake here.
\af[1]\n<\N[1]>Whatever it was, we need to make sure everyone is ok. We should get back to the surface.
\af[2]\n<\N[2]>I still have that bread you made. Eating it should help with the pain.
\af[2]\n<\N[2]>This lamp is still burning, there's likely some spare lantern fuel nearby.
You've found a small skeleton key.
\af[2]\n<\N[2]>You can say that again, I think this pickaxe was his weapon.
\af[2]\n<\N[2]>Wait! This doesn't look safe. It's too dark.
\af[1]\n<\N[1]>We'll be ok, it's the only way forward.
\af[2]\n<\N[2]>Watch out! I can smell a goblin up ahead.
\af[2]\n<\N[2]>I didn't think goblins had come this far south, I guess that's what Jackson was trying to tell us.
\af[2]\n<\N[2]>I don't know if we can handle an enemy like that yet but I bet we can grab something useful from him if we're quiet enough.
\af[1]\n<\N[1]>Huh?! You mean like pick his pockets, \N[2], I'm not sure I have the dexterity...
This dead goblin almost looks... sunburned.
This one didn't fare too well.
\af[1]\n<\N[1]>This guard's shield looks helpful, maybe I can keep us both safe with it.

\N<Skill>\n[1] has learned the "Guard" and "Taunting Guard" skills. Guarding reduces damage recieved for a set amount of turns. Taunting Guard, additionally, forces enemies to focus on you for the duration.

parameters.name: The Inkeeper Acts Really Nice, But Charges Outrageous Prices

parameters: \af[1]\n<\N[1]>He said we need to find to \N[4], I just hope \N[4] is still alive.
\af[2]\n<\N[2]>We'll find him. \|And when we do we'll figure this all out.
\af[1]\n<\N[1]>I hope so, the path looks dangerous ahead, I'm not sure how an old man like \N[4] would have survived.
\af[2]\n<\N[2]>Believe me,\| there's something about that guy, I feel he's more experienced than we think.
\af[2]\n<\N[2]>This bread still looks fresh enough to eat!
\af[2]\n<\N[2]>We should keep exploring, there must be a key somewhere in this place.
\af[2]\n<\N[2]>It looks like it was drawn here, but it's glowing.
Party fully healed, the light from the rune is dissipating.
\af[2]\n<\N[2]>Like I said, that was no normal earthquake. Something is happening here, something magical.
\af[1]\n<\N[1]>We should keep moving, we need to get out of these dungeons if we hope to find any answers.
\af[1]\n<\N[1]>It's blocking our path, we'll have to kill it.
\af[2]\n<\N[2]>Good thing that magical rune just healed us.
Party fully healed, the light from the rune is dissipating.
\af[2]\n<\N[2]>Not sure I'll ever get used to that.
\af[2]\n<\N[2]>Look! Over there, it looks like a shrine.
\af[1]\n<\N[1]>We need to roll this boulder out of the way.
